data.title: UI won't load
data.body:
After updating to 0.2.0.7 all i see is the menu bar and a blank page. I get this error when i reload:

```
Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, open 'C:\Users\juan\.atom\compile-cache\less\0cc7f11b7e69c0ffbafd9097990f1462ab8206dc\imports.json'
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.openSync (fs.js:544:18)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as openSync] (ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:118:20)
    at Object.fs.writeFileSync (fs.js:1155:15)
    at Object.fsPlus.writeFileSync (C:\Users\juan\AppData\Local\atom\app-0.207.0\resources\app.asar\node_modules\fs-plus\lib\fs-plus.js:279:17)
    at LessCache.module.exports.LessCache.writeJson (C:\Users\juan\AppData\Local\atom\app-0.207.0\resources\app.asar\node_modules\less-cache\lib\less-cache.js:155:17)
    at LessCache.module.exports.LessCache.setImportPaths (C:\Users\juan\AppData\Local\atom\app-0.207.0\resources\app.asar\node_modules\less-cache\lib\less-cache.js:113:12)
    at new LessCache (C:\Users\juan\AppData\Local\atom\app-0.207.0\resources\app.asar\node_modules\less-cache\lib\less-cache.js:32:12)
    at new LessCompileCache (C:\Users\juan\AppData\Local\atom\app-0.207.0\resources\app.asar\src\less-compile-cache.js:20:20)
    at ThemeManager.module.exports.ThemeManager.loadLessStylesheet (C:\Users\juan\AppData\Local\atom\app-0.207.0\resources\app.asar\src\theme-manager.js:299:26)index.js:66 handleSetupError
```

I was trying to change a syntax theme before updating, because afer 0.2.0.6 y was using metro-syntax but highlighting wasn't working. It threw some errors but before reporting it told to upgrade first. Now it's all blank.

![screenshot 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/955241/8026489/756ca4c0-0d3d-11e5-852c-8e391237eb40.png)

data.title: Atom cursor position is broken
data.body:
Copy this text in a new atom instance (`atom --safe`) and change the type of the text from `Plain Text` to `GitHub Markdown`: ```
``` Now place the cursor at the end of the second line (`

data.title: editor:select-to-end-of-line should work similarly to editor:move-to-end-of-line
data.body:
I'd normally use the `Shift + End` buttons to select the text from the current cursor position to the end of the line, but this doesn't seem to be working with Atom.

Let's say I have this long line:

```
This is a very long line of text that is used to test a bug report in Atom.
```

Now let's say I resize Atom's window so the line can't fit in a single row, specifically, the text `port in Atom.` is forced on a new row.

Now,  I'd expect that if I place the cursor at the beginning of the line and hit `Shift + End`, the entire text is selected. I'd even accept as a reasonable behavior if Atom selects everything up to the `test a bug re` part, but that is not the case. Atom is actually selecting everything on the first row of the line, except the last character. That is, in my example, after placing the cursor at the beginning of the line and hitting `Shift + End`, Atom is selecting this:

```
This is a very long line of text that is used to test a bug r
```

data.title: Enable "Downloading Update" context menu entry
data.body:
Previously `update-downloaded` would get emitted right after `update-available` which would suppress the "Downloading Update" menu entry.

I'm not too literate at Coffeescript so hopefully I put `@emit update-available` where it actually belongs :P.

Fixes #7128.

data.title: Only use lsb-core instead of full suite of lsb packages
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7096

`lsb` is quite a large package – we should just use what we need (which is `lsb-core`)

Tested on Fedora 21 and OpenSUSE 13.2

/cc @kevinsawicki

data.title: Restore session after install upgrade and relaunch
data.body:
When 'install upgrade and relaunch' atom can reload all opened files before.

Liu Jiang.

data.title: Little things missing from Vim ?
data.body:
HI !

First of all, I'm new to Atom. I discovered it yesterday. I would like to give it a chance, because it seems to be a wonderful tool.

For now, I'm trying to get back the stuff is set up over the years with Vim. I see 2 things for now:
- The template ability: in Vim, you can set up a template for each type file. Ex: you can set up a template for python files. When you create a file with the command `vim test.py`, test.py comes with some basic lines inside, like the shebang and the encoding. I've been looking around (maybe not enough), I found nothing about a similar stuff
- The sidebar: is it possible to display something else than a filebrowser in the sidebar ? Like a list of methods, the class, the attributes, etc ?

Anyway, congrats for developping such a great tool !

data.title: Unable to view local, featured, or search for any packages.
data.body:
Running version `0.207.0` on Windows 8.1.

Everything was running perfectly until I decided to make junction points from `C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local` to `D:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local`, `C:\Users\<username>\AppData\LocalLow` to `D:\Users\<username>\AppData\LocalLow`, and `C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming` to `D:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming` in order to free space on my C drive.

Anyway, ever since doing that, I was unable to search for any packages. The featured packages also fails with a seemingly uninformative error:
![](http://puu.sh/ifC5D/a5c3a514ce.png)

Also, viewing my local packages or themes doesn't work, as all the categories are frozen on "Loading packages...":
![](http://puu.sh/ifBOJ/ce82bb55d6.png)

In the Developer Console, there is an error about failing to fetch local packages:

```
Fetching local packages failed. Error: Fetching local packages failed.
  at D:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\atom\app-0.207.0\resources\app.asar\node_modules\settings-view\lib\package-manager.js:83:21
  at exit (D:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\atom\app-0.207.0\resources\app.asar\node_modules\settings-view\lib\package-manager.js:53:16)
  at triggerExitCallback (D:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\atom\app-0.207.0\resources\app.asar\src\buffered-process.js:213:47)
  at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (D:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\atom\app-0.207.0\resources\app.asar\src\buffered-process.js:235:18)
  at emitTwo (events.js:87:13)
  at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:169:7)
  at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:1057:12)
```

I could revert the junction points as a last resort if that's the only way to fix this problem, but I was wondering if anyone could pinpoint the exact cause of this issue.

data.title: C source code highlighting not functioning after macro definition containing > and parentheses
Remove mention of WorkspaceView which no longer exists
data.body: Fixes #7146

data.title: Update text-editor.coffee
data.body: Fix a typo in `src/text-editor.coffee` (`adter` => `after`).

data.title: [Feature Request] A way to diagnose freezes
data.body: Similiar to timecop, I'd like something to diagnose and log the random freezes and lag problems that have been happening to me and a few friends on a random basis. If there is already something like that in place, please excuse and close me :)

data.title: Give "items" more control over how they are saved.
data.body:
Currently there is no way for "items" (API level) to control how they are saved. For example some items might require that they are always saved with a particular file extension, but right now that's impossible to specify.

This pull request addresses the issue: #7145

data.title: Remove reference to WorkspaceView from Workspace documentation
data.body: ![napkin 06-06-15 7 31 51 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1038121/8022382/b3789622-0c82-11e5-9e19-0ac56d3d3dfc.png)

data.title: Item provides save panel options
data.body: This changes the pane.saveItemAs logic to look for a getSaveOptions method and if present those options will be passed into the save dialogue. This add flexibility, giving items more control over how the save dialog works. I need it so that I can include filter types in the save dialogue. But I expect there will be other uses cases going forward.

data.title: Expose `screenPositionForPixelPosition` on TextEditorElement
data.body: This PR exposes the `screenPositionForPixelPosition` method currently on the `TextEditor` model. We expose this method on the view instead of the model because it should only be called when the editor is on screen.

data.title: Atom reopens files on reload but doesn't check to see if they still exist, opens empty tabs
data.body:
Atom 0.207

Scenario: open files in Atom for editing, close Atom, move files, reopen Atom and it attempts to open the files but it cannot because they have been moved but it still opens empty tabs with the same names as the files previously edited.

data.title: -webkit-font-feature-settings: "calt" on, stopped working
data.body: Any recent code change that could explain this? The font with contextual alternates continues to work fine in other programs and worked fine i Atom just a couple of hours ago.

data.title: Running Atom from shell fails on Windows
data.body:
**Version:** Atom v0.207
**OS:** Windows 8.1

Hello. Recently, when I tried to run `atom somefile.txt` from [Git for Windows](https://github.com/git-for-windows/git/releases), I got an error in the `atom` script that said `No such file or directory`. When I opened the `atom` script file, I saw this:

```
"$0/../../app-0.204.0/resources/cli/atom.sh" "$@"
```

Realizing that `$0` should instead have been `$(dirname $0)` instead, I replaced it and tried again. I also found this problem in the script it pointed to (atom.sh).

The problem is that **when Atom updates it erases the fix**, which is why I filed this bug report.

As someone [in the forums](https://discuss.atom.io/t/running-atom-from-shell-doesnt-work-on-windows/17496) noted, `atom.cmd` works fine.

Image:

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9159214/8021375/8a9ab616-0c6b-11e5-9efc-c7b1511a5f7b.png)

**NOTE: This applies to apm and the script it points to, as well.**

data.body: There is a problem . When I sometimes want to save my files , and press down "Save" or "Ctrl+S" , the file wil be empty and it saved! And then all what I had typed is lost .

data.title: The effect of Ctrl+k takes 1 or 2 seconds to appear
data.body:
Running Atom 0.207.0 on OSX Yosemite.

Ctrl+k cuts the text from the caret to the end of the line (or the end of the line itself if you are already at the end of the line).

However, with the current Atom 0.207.0, when cutting text with Ctrl+k, the text takes 1 or 2 seconds to disappear from the screen. I would expect it to be instantaneous (like when you select text to the end of the line and cut it).
